buy something ↔ in.translation[0].defini: to buy something in large quantities
Companies are buying in supplies of paper, in case the price goes up.
buy something ↔ in.translation[1].defini: if an organization buys in parts or services, it gets them from another company, rather than produce them itself
Under the new system, schools have to buy in the services of advisers and librarians.
buy something ↔ in.translation[2].defini: when a company buys its own shares from existing shareholders
A buy-in has the advantage of removing small shareholders and frees the parent company to run the unit.
